Reviews.Title: “This hotel closed in mid-July”
Reviews.Author: JMfromMemphis
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn was purchased by new owners and closed down in mid-July. The Holiday Inn signs have been removed. News reports indicate that new owner plans to renovate the property and rebrand it.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be updated”
Reviews.Author: traveler60864
Reviews.Content: When i visited this hotel, i was not satisfied. the parking is crazy, location was okay, the beds had wheels on them as if they were portable, also not stable, the beds were not made when i arriived, no microwave or refridgerator was availible , the bottom of the tub was lifted out, and toilet was not stable. I spoke with manager the following day, no discount or upgrade was giving, but i was told to come back and ill get a better room. THERE IS NO WAY I WOULD EVER GO BACK!!!

Reviews.Title: “Spirit of Customer Service is all over this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 365Dreamer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here a few days on our adventure Vacation this year. Our Bucket list included seeing Elvis Presley's beloved Graceland and then to points out West. From the moment we entered the lobby we could feel the warmth of the employee's and their team spirit. How refreshing! The employee's from the front desk to the bellman and even the housekeeping staff were personable and very professional. The hotel is nice and had everything we needed. The location was great! Easy access to freeways also. When you are visiting Memphis whether business or pleasure this hotel would be a good choice. While there, one simply must go into the Gift Shop and meet 'Miss Jane'. Charming is the best way to describe this fascinating woman. She is truly a genuine treasure. She could easily have been an Ambassador. 'Miss Jane' also has a wealth of knowledge about her beloved city. You will spend a few minutes with her and feel that you have known her a lifetime and as in my case, I wish that I had. Why the movie producers or writers have not discovered her is beyond me. She is absolutely fascinating! Just a note of interest. We enjoyed our stay at the Holiday Inn East Memphis so much that out of all the hotels we could have chosen, we chose this one once again when we were traveling back home to Florida .

Reviews.Title: “Run FAR AWAY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: la_solitaria
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels of many different brands, but this one takes the cake as an old, dated and VERY DIRTY hotel. While the staff I encountered was very friendly & polite, you could tell that no one cared about caring for or maintaining this hotel. Where do I even begin? I thought that Holiday Inn had booted all the old and bad ones from the system. Not this one. Why, I don't know. They haven't relaunched, neither have they done any sort of updating or renovations in what looks like 15 years. That is probably how old my old & painful mattress was. I had a hard time falling asleep due to the terrible back pain that the mattress caused me. However, let's get back to the cleanliness. Carpets are filthy, grimy & worn. I saw lots of roaches crawling around outside the pool & fitness center first thing in the morning. Room air conditioners are probably 20 years old, though they did cool fine, just loud. However, the room stunk something terrible. I was afraid to look at the A/Cs to see how dirty they were, as that is no doubt where a lot of the odor came from. I did have a tiny fridge & a microwave. Went to throw some stuff in the fridge, not only was it not on, but it smelled so bad that it knocked me a few feet back. No shower curtain liner, broken clock, only a soap & shampoo, ratty, lumpy old pillows. Dirty phones, dirty tub & bath & carpet... I could go on and on. I am not sure there was one thing in the room that wasn't dirty, worn or needed replacing. The wallpaper in the halls is old, scratched up and peeling. If you don't mind staying at a dump, then by all means stay here. A property that cuts this many corners makes me wonder if they even do things like change the sheets. Do yourself a favor and stay anywhere else. You could probably get a better room at a Super 8 even.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: SuZQ96
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Memphis for his birthday. When we checked in we told the desk clerk what we were in town for and she remembered us every time we came through the lobby. She even told him Happy Birthday on his actual birthday. We had a little trouble with the A/C and went down to the front desk to report it. The maintenance man was in our room within 10 minutes. We had a very nice stay and will definitely stay here again. If I had to pick a con re: this hotel, it would be the cost of breakfast. I thought a continental breakfast was free, but not here. Although we did get one free breakfast by siging up for Priority rewards.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MTColeman
Reviews.Content: When I checked in as a Priority Club member I was assigned to room 1026 on the Concierge Level. When I got to my room I found the bed linens on the floor. There were dirty food containers in the room. It was obvious the room had not been made up. I returned to the front desk and received an apology. I was then assigned room 908. Due to my change in room assignments I was unable to take advantage of the complimentary breakfast for Priority Club members on the Concierge Level.. I worked out in the fitness room, all was good there except the TV did not work. I called the front desk for repair-no one came, When I tried to take a shower the shower hed sprayed water out on th toilet instead of in the tub. I requested repair from the Front Desk at 7:00 PM, the repair was not made until 7:40. The towels were threadbare with torn hems. Needless to say this is not what I expect from Holiday Inn hotels. As a Priority Club member I use Holiday Inn hotels exclusively.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: shiny62
Reviews.Content: Very nice Holiday Inn. Clean and quiet. Note: Follow the directions to the entrance carefully. It can be tricky to find otherwise. It is frustrating to be able to see the hotel but not able to get to it. The hotel is in the middle of an interchange. Convenient (though not walkable) to Best Buy and Target and many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay.”
Reviews.Author: TJK39
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Near plenty of resturants and shopping. Also had a nice bar with good food on site. If I had a complaint, it would be that no breakfast is included if not a priority member. For less per night this is included at other hotels. Otherwise it was fine, would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Comfort”
Reviews.Author: AdamKurkowski
Reviews.Content: I have found that this hotel is by far the best one out of the hotels i've stayed in the memphis east area. From the time I checked in to the time I left, it is like being home away from home. The one thing that I really appreciate about this hotel is the customer service, it is unsurpassed by any measure, and the staff there is the friendliest i have ever seen. I travel all the time and I would choose holiday inns every time.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel”
Reviews.Author: girlygirl101
Reviews.Content: The hotel needs some updating. The furniture was old and beat up. They have tube TVs. I ate at the hotel three times and the food was barely ok. The whole "hot" breakfast buffet was cold, the pasta at dinner was undercooked and room service took twice as long as they said it would be. The staff in the restaurant was not friendly or helpful. The front desk staff was friendly though. It was very quiet on my floor though which is great for light sleepers! I would probably not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: havinfunn
Reviews.Content: My family and I had such a great stay at this hotel. It is right in the middle of everything we wanted to do. From the shuttle drivers, front desk, to the waiters and cooks everyone was so wonderful and helpful. Even the GM was walking by me in the lobby and greeted us and actually asked us how our stay was going. She actually cared enough to ask. I have not had that happen in a long time!!!! Kudos to the entire staff and I will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Expected Better”
Reviews.Author: N717JG
Reviews.Content: The Bed... That was the only good part about my stay. The Shuttle Driver was nice as well, but my room smelled like STRONG BLEACH!!! and it gave me a massive headache. The bed was comfortable, but I didn't sleep very well due to the bleachy smell in my room. I used my priority club points for this, and given my overall stay, I wish I hadn't. :-(... Oh. and the light in the corner by the window did NOT work. >:-( So much for sitting up and reading.

Reviews.Title: “Guest service upgrade needed!”
Reviews.Author: Bkitch33
Reviews.Content: The front desk clerk was very rude on the phone and in person. Lashona I believe was her name, was not helpful to say the least and seemed she had other priorities that were more important then to help her guests.... It was the most unprofessional I have ever seen a front desk clerk act at a holiday inn!

Reviews.Title: “Needs serious updating”
Reviews.Author: DP4
Reviews.Content: The smelled funny. The room was out dated. The hall smelled bad too. Breakfast was not that great. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Always Enjoy Staying Here”
Reviews.Author: mikegolf123
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times over the past three years and always enjoyed my stay. The afternoon reception is good and the drinks are free. Shuttle drivers are friendly and are available to take you anywhere close by.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: tonystan
Reviews.Content: This is an older property in a nice area east of Memphis. As others have noted, the entrance is a bit awkward, but nothing the hotel can really do about that. Every encounter with hotel personnel was very friendly, I was greeted with a smile at every encounter, from the front desk, to housekeeping, to security, to the doorman, to the shuttle driver -- you really felt welcome at the hotel. My observation was that the common areas were clean, more importantly, the room was as well. The bed was very comfortable and the linens were of the quality you would expect at a hotel of this class (basically not silky, but not sandpaper, perfectly comfortable). Really, aside from the awkward entrance to the property, the only knock against the hotel would be that it is an older place, and you can tell that the carpets and some furniture (though clean) are worn and the in-room tvs are the older style -- I would imagine when this hotel gets the new Holiday Inn upgrade it will be top notch. And yes, the complimentary lemon water in the lobby is very refreshing on a hot summer day!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: denpow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a family gathering and found it to be very pleasant. Rooms were very nice, clean and spacious. The staff was pleasant and helpful. There are restaurants in the area, however the hotel is a little difficult to get to from the highway. Used the lobby and pool extensively for getting together with family - very nice facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Always comfortable, a good sleep.”
Reviews.Author: SomnioAmo
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn is quite nice. I enjoy the rooms, they are large and well-appointed. During the week, a Priority Club lounge is opened for "happy hour". The hotel shuttle is available to take you where you need to go in the area and there is a restaurant/bar in the hotel. One thing that really bothers me about this hotel is the pool. It's indoor and I have often found it to be a bit dirty. It is also a sort of maze to get to.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: havinfunn
Reviews.Content: I had the best time at this hotel. Great location, great service, we had a blast. Upon check in we were welcomed by a very friendly desk clerk. Getting to my room it was very clean and everything that we needed. The food and beverage staff was great! The bartender was very friendly and knew a lot about the area. Anytime I come to this area, this is the hotel that I will be staying at!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: HenrySmithson
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn is well-maintained, clean, comfortable, and employs a friendly and efficient staff. It is located in East Memphis, away from the main attractions of this city, but is surrounded by many fine restaurants and B-BQ eateries.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your bill”
Reviews.Author: hud1
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in September of 2009 for a workshop. The business had a special rate for us. I did not get the special rate when I checked out so they corrected the bill. Next thing I know my credit card is charged extra which is actually more than the first amount that was corrected and NOW they say I checked out late and they charged for an extra day which is not correct.

Reviews.Title: “It was alright”
Reviews.Author: Desespoir
Reviews.Content: For the price I paid, I wasn't disappointed. The location is one of my favourite areas to stay in Memphis. The downsides were that the room had no mini-fridge (other comparable hotels in the area do), the TV was just awful, and the heater/AC unit was *loud* The upsides were that I had a fantastic view, the cleaning staff wasn't intrusive and noisy, the parking was good, and as i mentioned the area was great. The room itself was a bit small but since it was just me that's not a problem. I could see 2 people feeling cramped though. The bathroom was great. I'd recommend it for a solo traveler, or a couple on a strict budget.

Reviews.Title: “It was just ok”
Reviews.Author: LBW88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in need of a face lift. Rooms are spacious but need updating. It would have been nice to have a fridge in the room. Staff was very friendly. Hard to get to entrance of hotel during heavy traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly, Unclean & Pricey!”
Reviews.Author: ThinOne
Reviews.Content: I was most disappointed with my stay at this hotel. My room was so filthy, I was afraid to walk without my shoes on. The staff was very unhelpful & not friendly at all. I ventured down to the front desk to complain and encountered an employee on my way, and began to tell her about the condition of my room. I was told by this black female I encountered that the condition of the rooms was not her responsibility. She said she was the Human Resources Manager, and I should contact either the General Manager or the Housekeeper if I had an "issue" with my room. I returned to my room, called the nearby Hilton for a room & immediately checked out. I have to wonder if anyone stays there more than once/

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: smstev42
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel through Delta because of a missed flight and if you are ever in Memphis, stay away from this hotel. I have stayed in many hotels in my lifetime and this is by far the worst one i have ever been in. The main issues with the hotel were: 1. Rooms smelled terrible, so bad that I only slept 2 hours and came to the airport 4 hours early just to get out of the nasty smell! 2. The bathrooms were filled with scum and hair all over the sinks and shower. 3. Room service took almost an hour and a half to get and there was no selection of anything remotely healthy on the menu. 4. When turning on the heating unit, smoke came out and smelled like the room was about to catch on fire. I am sure that I can tell you about many other things, but I dont want to waste anymore time on this filth of a place!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is really showing it's age. Worth it if you use Priceline.”
Reviews.Author: wmchan
Reviews.Content: Got this through Priceline for $42. I sure wouldn't pay list price. It is a good location and because of the security features it feels safe. Now for the hotel. It is really run down and it calls itself Holiday Inn Select! Bed was good, but holes in the bathroom walls, dated fixtures, wobbly toilet, bathtub needed replacing, etc. You don't get breakfast here, but there are plenty of places to eat nearby. This is the third time I've gotten this through priceline and they rate it a 3 1/2 star hotel. It really isn't, but at $42 what the heck. I'm gonna say I recommend his hotel, but only if you get a really good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ttn1
Reviews.Content: We all liked the rooms. The location of this hotel is confusing and hard to find even with a GPS. A lot of going rounds to turn into the parking lot. The pool was small and sufficient for our small kids. Unfortunately, it's the other guests that hogged the pool and were being loud about it.

Reviews.Title: “Solid”
Reviews.Author: cugrad2k1
Reviews.Content: Overall, no complaints. Cheap, clean, professional, easily accessible. Best Target ever right by there too! Only nitpicking comments are that a free continental breakfast would be nice, as would a refrigerator and box of tissues in the room. In any case, at the low Priceline rate, I was very pleased with what I had. The nearby Target provided a good and inexpensive breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel for a quick trip to Memphis”
Reviews.Author: AKAPearl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night during a stayover trip to Memphis. I bid on Priceline, and this is the hotel that I got. For my bidding price, the value for the money was fair. The hotel is conveniently located right off of 240. The hallways are a bit outdated, but the room itself was decent. The bed was comfy and the bathroom was clean. The was ample (free) parking. If you are looking for an average hotel this is it.

Reviews.Title: “I was scared to even walk barefoot on the carpet”
Reviews.Author: PHXroadwarrior
Reviews.Content: I was stuck in Memphis overnight due to an airline problem and this was the only available room I could find. What a scary, disgusting hotel. The room had the outdated, not-stylish-even-ten-years-ago furniture you see in the photos, and it had seen better days. The room's TV was a circa 1988 model into which someone apparently from Dallas (that's what it said) had carved their initials on the front. The bathroom had moldy, peeling paint on the ceiling. The bed had one of those polyester bedspreads with a pattern that hides stains that every other decent chain got rid of a few years ago because everyone knows how gross and disgusting hotel bedspreads are. The only nice thing I can say is that the shaving mirror in the shower was really handy. Seriously, it's like the place has not been touched in a decade. And this is a Holiday Inn SELECT, which is supposedly one of their better properties? I had not stayed in a Holiday Inn property for a few years (I stay at Marriott and Starwood properties almost 200 nights a year, so I have seen a LOT of hotels) and based on what I saw here, I'm not anxious to try one again anytime soon. I'm shocked that something so disgusting would be a part of an international chain with any standards whatsoever. I think I'll sleep in the airport next time if this is my only option.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine, nice staff, no complaints from me!”
Reviews.Author: Dznygrl
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel thru a Priceline bid. We were attending a conference at the nearby Hilton. The Holiday Inn was very busy due to 4 family reunions, a school reunion and several meetings, but we had no problems with check-in or service. Front desk staff was very friendly. Obviously an older hotel that's been revamped. Room was spacious, clean, and the A/C worked well. Better than other Holiday Inn's I've stayed at in the past. Plenty of parking, we never had to hunt for a spot even with all the events going on. Hotel is located right on I-240, so if you miss the hotel entrance, it takes a few minutes to wind your way back around. Located in a safe area, close to Starbucks, Olive Garden, and just about any other chain restaurant you desire. We were very satisfied with our stay and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, But Difficult to Get To”
Reviews.Author: dillonh
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from the Holiday Inn Select in Memphis and I can't say enough about the service we received and the friendliness of the staff. I was VERY hesitant to stay here after reading the reviews about the staff not being accommodating, difficult to enter and exit (it is), poor service, dingy and in dire need of upgrade. However, my daughter's basketball team was booked at the Holiday Inn and we wanted to stay where the team was staying. I was so concerned I booked another hotel as a back-up. We arrived early so we could switch hotels if need be. We were greeted by Rachel, who checked us in with amazing efficiency and friendliness. Our room's air conditioning was not working, and within 30 minutes, the maintenance worker switched out the wall unit. However, that unit did not function properly either. In less than 5 minutes, the bellman was at our door with keys to another room. The hotel is old, but I would not describe it as dingy or dirty. It was fine. I have never been to a hotel where the staff was friendlier than they were at this hotel. Rachel suggested Ken Neely's Bar-B-Que. She even offered to let us (16 kids and adults) bring the food to the hotel and eat together in a corner of the restaurant. Where else would anyone have done this? We weren't sure when we would need to check-out due to the basketball games, but we didn't have to worry because the hotel worked with us and allowed us to check out late. The bar and restaurant staff were very friendly and service oriented. The hotel is difficult to get into and out of. The only other complaint I have is the size of the "double" beds. They are not true double beds. So, it was uncomfortable for my husband to share a bed smaller than a double bed. There are plenty of restaurants nearby. Wi-Fi is free.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy your stay, unless you're one of "those"...”
Reviews.Author: essbreezy
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was not accommodating. Although I arrived 30 minutes prior to check-in, and the hotel parking lot was nearly empty, I was told that the only thing available was a smoking room because, "That's how it is when you go through Priceline or Hotwire." The smoking room was awful. No ventilation, smokey, stuffy, etc. I went back downstairs because it was unacceptable. Again, I was told that everything else was booked for other guests. The manager overheard and suggested that the staff member check again. The staff member complains to the manager that we are Priceline guests, and reiterates that "that's how it is with Priceline." However, thanks to the manager's intervention, we were moved to one of the many available non-smoking rooms. But by that time, my impression was set. Because of my experience here, I'm not sure that the money saved with Priceline is worth it for the stepchild-like treatment I'll receive.

Reviews.Title: “The Blues in Memphis”
Reviews.Author: buffalobabe
Reviews.Content: I just finished a three day stay at this hotel for a business seminar and this hotel will definitely give you the blues while staying in Memphis. It is not worth the $139.00 a night and is far from select. The hotel is difficult to enter and exit due to location. The service is poorand the rooms are in dire need of an upgrade. They are very dingey and has poor lighting. The TV reception was terrible. Room service was horrible! I called to order breakfast and was told they couldnt get to me for another 45 min and hung up. When i called back after 45 min. nooone answered the phone. To access the pool and exercise facility you have to go down elevator to the 3rd floor, walk down corridor and then take another elevator to the 1st floor. The pool area was dingy and dirty. There was gum on the floor in several areas and dirty cigarette butts in the corner. The nautilus equip was rusted and the walls are painted a peptobismal pink . The only thing that was adequate was the dining lounge which had decent food and service. I would never stay at this hotel again as there are other hotels in the area which are much better than this .

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of suburban Memphis”
Reviews.Author: OilIsle
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location, just off the highway on Poplar Avenue. It is convenient to the East Memphis/Germantown area. The hotel is nicer than a standard Holiday Inn. There was nothing especially memorable, but it was clean and comfortable. The hotel shuttle to the airport was particularly convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: alynde
Reviews.Content: I will admit that I was disappointed when the Holiday Inn came up through Priceline; however, I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived. It was a little tricky to get into the hotel from the highway, but other than that I found the location great as well. It was around 15 minutes to get anywhere we wanted to go. The hotel was way above my expectations. I paid $50 a night and we upgraded for an extra $10 a night to a suite. We ended up with a king corner mini suite. Very spacious and quiet. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. I also liked that it has a gated area around the parking lot. Only disappointment was that there was not any pay per view movies available or minibars. We did have a fridge and microwave in our suite though. Pool and spa were nice as was the work out room. Overall a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “no problems”
Reviews.Author: ih1dnk
Reviews.Content: I don't know why it is, but we always prefer 2.5 star hotels to 3 star. It has nothing to do with the hotel, it's just that the personal amenities we look for are usually better with a 2.5 star hotel. Our recent stay at this Holiday Inn was no different. The check-in was super easy, room was clean and recently updated. The bed was comfortable and had plenty of pillows. They even offer a pillow service where you can request feather, foam, firm, soft, or a neck pillow. One problem was that we reserved a room with two doubles but when we checked in we were told none where available. The king room we got was just fine for our family, but if there were 4 adults I would have been mad. Turns out this was because a high school marching band took up several floors. Other than lots of doors slamming and a few conversations passing by our room, it really wasn't too loud. I would have been happier with more room amenities like a mini fridge and microwave. They had a coffee maker that didn't work, but during the week they offered coffee in the lobby. We also wished we had a continental breakfast. We didn't bother to pay for their breakfast, but the dining room looked very clean and nice. Another complaint is that their "complimentary shuttle" actually cost $20 per person to go to the Liberty Bowl (7 miles away). We chose to drive and pay the $10 parking...

Reviews.Title: “this was a shabby place”
Reviews.Author: mwellso
Reviews.Content: we have been on the road for a month and booked our rooms through priceline w/the help of one of our children in her home. we have done well overall and not been displeased until we got to this hotel. it was billed as a 3 star hotel first of all so we bid more than we would have for a 2 and 1/2 star. we had been staying at 2 and 1/2 stars all along and found them clean, pleasant, most w/breakfasts, some w/dinners, pleasant staff, and access to gyms. i don't know why we went w/a three star that time but it was no 3 star place. our toilet had pubic hairs and toilet paper in it and the seat up when we went in. the bathroom floor was not very clean but had various "things" on it not vacuumed up. the non-skid tub lining was cracked and seedy looking. the light in the bathroom was very dim. our carpet had not been vacuumed well. the elevator car was dingy and dirty w/debris not vacuumed up. it also had flooring torn up in spots. the lobby carpet had not been vacuumed and the lobby bathroom was dirty and had no paper towels in the dispenser and no blow dryer. the breakfast buffet was non appetizing in appearance and the fruit was not ripe. it was yet expensive. the waitress at breakfast spent her time talking to another guest the entire time. it was overall a shabby little deal. i wrote priceline about this and holiday inn.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel for a night!”
Reviews.Author: tripkim
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel for $70/night from Priceline. I was hoping to stay at the Memphis Hilton, but this one came up instead. After reading some of the reviews here about the Holiday Inn I was a little nervous about what our stay would be like. With all that being said, we were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. We had no problems checking in! There was plenty of free parking as well as a quick elevator to our room. This was by no means the fanciest hotel in the world, but it was great for our one night stay in Memphis. The beds were comfy, we had plenty of pillows and the bathroom was clean! Keep in mind when looking for a Memphis hotel that this area is not convenient to downtown if you plan on spending a lot of time down there. We like the area because it has very quick access to the interstate so we can get a quick start on our drive the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but too far from downtown attractions”
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. No issues with staff, room, safety, cleanliness etc. Top notch all the way. I thought I would stay at this location to save a few bucks (downtown hotels are a few hundred $$$ per night). Given the choice, I would have bit the bullet and stayed downtown. This Holiday Inn is about a 20-25minute drive to downtown, 20 minutes to Graceland and STAX records. Again, if you're passing through town or have an appointment in the East end of town, I highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service in Memphis”
Reviews.Author: leslie66
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Memphis for a weekend stay for a soccer tournament. We had a signed contract for a block of 28 rooms. When we arrived, the staff was rude and acted "put out" to answer questions or provide any sort of assistance. We were promised all double rooms-about a third were kings. Some rooms had no toiletries, and when we went back to the desk to request some, they acted as if they were asked to go purchase them for us. We were promised complimentary breakfast. There was none. We complained enough, and produced proof in writing that it was promised so they finally agreed to provide it on Sunday morning (on Saturday we had to go to a restaurant). When we arrived at breakfast at 830, it was gone. (They had promised to have it available from 7am until 11am.) The attendant told us his boss said not to put any more out because we were not paying for it. Eventually, they did put out more cereal. The rooms were barely cleaned during our stay. The overall attitude of the staff was that we were inconveniencing them by showing up at the hotel. It was not just us; we also witnessed this treatement to anyone who approached the desk. Soccer teams or groups: do NOT stay here!! We have never been treated like this anywhere, and we travel quite a bit. I asked to speak to the manager, and I was told he was not available until Monday. Southern hospitality does not exist here.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great staff, no problems”
Reviews.Author: jdvmd
Reviews.Content: Once again I find myself writing a Tripadvisor review that will totally go against recent reviews. I have decided to take such reviews with a grain of salt and figured out a long time ago that the problems lie more with the reviewer than with the properties themselves. That said, we had an absolutely wonderful time at the Holiday Inn and found everyone who worked there to be most courteous, helpful and just downright nice. The front-desk staff, beds, tolietries were wonderful. We paid $46 through Priceline and there was no mention of it except on our check-out slip. The room was very comfortable and the bathroom large. There were tons of pillows and towels. The hallways and the elevator were clean. Since we arrived late and had to catch an early flight, we weren't able to enjoy the pool or other amenities. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “How does one get hairs on the ceiling?”
Reviews.Author: eljefe883
Reviews.Content: While traveling over 2,000 miles in five days with a pregnant wife, sister, brother-in-law and their cat to visit the parents for Thanksgiving, we decided to stay in Memphis for a night's rest. I got a room at this hotel via Priceline, and it was not one of my better Priceline experiences for either quality of price. First of all, it is unclear how to get to this hotel from the freeway (you have to make a U-turn and go into a gated entrance), and there isnâ€™t any signage to help one out. Late night check-in was efficient but not courteous. That being said, the located in a median between the lanes of a split highway is very safe and well lit. Most of the common areas were dirty, especially the stairways, and no carpet, fixtures, etc. seems to have been refreshed for at least 5-10 years. The double beds were comfortable but too small for me, a pregnant lady and a twenty pound feline. The carpet and furniture seemed dingy and there were unpainted repairs to the woodwork. While the bathroom seemed clean, I noticed that a few hairs (and not the ones found on your head) were somehow adhered to the ceiling, a fact I did not point out to my companions until we were back on the road to protect their gag reflexes. I have stayed in freeway motels that were classier than this place and do not know how Priceline rated it at 2.5-3 stars. I can say, however, that the wireless internet and TV worked fine and that we successfully sneaked the cat in and out without incident. I was disappointed with the room for the rate I paid and would have been really peeved if I had shelled out for rack rates.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, crude, and abused.”
Reviews.Author: TeamW
Reviews.Content: The staff was rude. The room had air that worked (sorta). The furniture, mattress, and carpet were gross. The pool was cloudy and dirty. The elevator had the some gob of goo on the push buttons when we checked in on Saturday afternoon. The same goo gob was still there Sunday morning. Yuck-ola.

Reviews.Title: “Neutral, Worn and Tired looking hotel lobby and room”
Reviews.Author: darkbeer_lover
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks tired and worn out. The room that we got (NS King size bed) was neutrally impressive. No bells and whistles. Noisy hallways. Checked the pool out. It is a hike from where we were (4th floor). You have to take the elevator down. Walk about 5 minutes to another elevator that takes you to the pool and gym area. Ride a very small elevator. Then step onto very wet pavement right off the elevator. If you book off Holiday Inn directly, you will pay around $100. We booked thru Hotwire for $65. For the price that we paid, the standard, amenities (or lack thereof) is proportional. Otherwise we would have checked in at Homewood Suites which is right beside Holiday Inn Select Poplar Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “The good times”
Reviews.Author: ashpooh1984
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our anniversary and the service was great, but the housekeepers service was very poor. The room was good and the person who checked us in was NICE and she even gave us complimentary breakfast. The breakfast was GOOOD. The beds was very comfortable and they have very good security even though nothing had happened. Most of we had fun and the spa or whirlpool was very comfortable and warm the water is a little mirky but my experience here was very good and I would stay again when I go back to Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “Just Plain Dirty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the weekend with my two small children and father. On Saturday morning while I was getting ready for the day, my father took my children down to the pool to swim. When I went down to the pool to check on them, I tried for 15min to get to the pool via the elevator. When the elevator did not come, I contacted the front desk and they informed me that the pool was closed and that the elevator was broken. I told them that my father and two small children were in the pool area and I needed to check on them. I had to walk outside and around the hotel and bang on the door to let my unsuspecting father know that they could not get out of the pool via the elevator. There were no towels available to dry off and my father had requested some from guest services. We waited 30min for towels, when that didn't happen we had to carry the children back out and around the hotel in the freezing cold in order to get back to our room. I can understand things breaking, however the condition of the water was so dirty that you couldn't even see the bottom of the pool (my fault for sending them down with Grandpa) I would not have let them swim! The hot tub was broken and appeared to have been that way for some time as it was discustingly dirty. The pool deck was coated with what appeared to be fungus. I won't be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice place, good price.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here with another couple (two king rooms) and had no major problems. The room was clean and bed was very comfy, must have replaced mattresses since the earlier post, ours was not hard at all. Wireless internet in rooms is a nice touch. Free monitored parking, only complaint was the noise from the air conditioning unit. Both rooms had a constant hum and when the indiv. room unit kicked on it was loud. They have an airport shuttle that may even take you down to Beale (if you know what I mean)...restaurant charged $5.95 for the continental breakfast, thought that was a bit pricey but good experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “A decent Holiday Inn Select. (Memphis - East/I-240)”
Reviews.Author: michael_210
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Select - Memphis, TN (East) This is a review of the Holiday Inn Select East in Memphis Tennessee on Poplar Avenue. We stayed in this Holiday Inn in May 2005. Rates were around $55/night (business rate). This is your typical Holiday Inn Select that you are used to, but is one of the older properties, but has been kept up nicely and was very clean. It has an restuarant, plenty of parking, is conveinent right on Interstate I-240. The Rooms: The rooms were normal style and typical Holiday Inn. They weren't as fancy as most "Select" properties, but a little nicer than a regular Holiday Inn room. The room we stayed in had a King bed, a couch, a desk area and a TV in a TV cabinet. Nice features were a second phone at the desk and free "Wireless Ethernet" (802.11g) connection for guests. The wireless ethernet connection was just one click to agree to use terms and you were on the internet. The only big negatives I can say about this hotel was the room, or more specficially the bed. This has to be one of the "cheapest" mattresses I've ever slept on. I'd compare it to a mattress in a "Motel 6". For a Holiday Inn Select, they should have a much better mattress. It was very hard and cheap feeling and not much fun to sleep on. The old style wall mount A/C unit, while it worked fine, was extremely noisey. Anytime it cycled on, you had to pick up the TV remote and turn up the TV to watch it. When it cycled off, you had to turn the TV back down. But I could live with the noisey A/C if the mattress was just better. Fitness Center & Pool area: They had an older but decent fitness center at this location. It had 2 threadmills, 3 stair stepper machines, a stationary type bike, and a large multifunction Nautilus machine. The pool was an indoor one about the size of a large home pool with a nice deck area with chairs/tables around it. It was nothing fancy, but kids who love to swim wouldn't have any problem with is. Restuarant: We ate breakfast at the breakfast buffett in the main lobby restuarant. Again, typical Holiday Inn style operation with expected results. It was kinda pricey though for a buffett at $15 per person including breakfast, coffee, juice and gratuity. Service from the waitstaff was very good though. Other Ammenities: This hotel appears to have lots of meeting rooms and ballrooms. There were several corporate style meetings going on during our visit and they seemed to be geared towards this. There is also a very small gift shop in the lobby that had a few tourist type items. When we checked in we noticed some guests using a computer in the lobby looking up something on the internet or something. So there appears that there might be a "general guest use" computer for those who don't bring a laptop. One other thing to note was that security patrolled the parking lot in a golf cart and did a good job of making sure that everyone that was in the parking lot belonged there. I'm not sure if this was indicitive of a break in problem in the parking lot in past warranting these patrols or them just providing good customer care. Would we stay there again? Only if we had a meeting in the hotel or just because it was a great rate compared to other memphis hotels of this higher end. We just really didn't like that cheap mattress. Hope this review has been very helpful to all.

Reviews.Title: “Service was Great - Rooms ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed Easter Weekend while in Memphis visiting family. The service was great and staff very nice -- buffet breakfast in restaurant was great, waitresses very friendly. Kids loved the indoor pool. Beds were ok and rooms were average size. Security for hotel was excellent -- guard patrolled parking lot 24 hours a day and entrances to parking lot were controlled. We actually left something in the room and the staff was very accomodating in fed-ex'ing it to us. Overall, I reccommend this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Select Memphis-East Poplar & I-240
HotelInfo.Address: 5795 Poplar Ave., Memphis, TN 38119
